titles.title: I Heard The Bells On Christmas Day

authors.author: Henry W. Longfellow Jean Baptiste Calkin

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: I heard the bells on Christmas day, newline Their old familiar carols play; newline And wild and sweet the words repeat, newline Of peace on earth, good will to men.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: I thought how as the day had come, newline The belfries of all Christendom; newline Had rolled along the unbroken song, newline Of peace on earth, good will to men.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: And in despair I bowed my head, newline "There is no peace on earth," I said; newline "For hate is strong and mocks the song, newline Of peace on earth, good will to men."

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Then pealed the bells more loud and deep, newline "God is not dead, nor doth He sleep; newline The wrong shall fail, the right prevail, newline With peace on earth, good will to men."

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Till ringing, singing on its way, newline The world revolved from night to day; newline A voice, a chime, a chant sublime newline Of peace on earth, good will to men.
